1996, the following instructions regarding Airport Security Committee at the 
airports are issued for implementation by all concerned: 
 
2.

coordinate implementation of the requirements of National Civil 
Aviation Security Programme; 
(ii) 
provide a forum for discussion of aviation security matters affecting the 
airport and its users; and 
(iii)

4. 
The terms of reference for the Airport Security Committee shall be as 
under: 
 
(a) 
Coordinate the implementation of the national civil  aviation security 
programme at the airport. 
(b) 
Oversee and monitor the airport security programme, including special 
measures introduced by the airport administration, operators and 
airport tenants. 
(c) 
Use the national civil aviation security programme/ airport security 
programme as a guide.

Draw up and maintain a list of vulnerable points including essential 
equipment and facilities and review the security of those points from

(e) 
Ensure that basic minimum security measures and procedures are 
adequate to meet threats and are under constant review, providing for 
normal situations and contingencies for periods of heightened tension 
and emergency situations. 
(f) 
Ensure that recommendations for improvement in security measures 
and procedures are implemented. 
(g) 
Ensure that the planning of airport expansion programmes includes the 
planning of modifications to be made to airport control systems and

(h) 
Examine implementation of the security measures and procedures and 
consider ways and means for their effective implementation. 
(i) 
Consider the adequacy of the prescribed minimum security measures 
and procedures to meet threats during normal situation, periods of 
heightened tension and emergency situation. 
(j) 
Review the list of vital points and the Contingency Plan for the airport 
regularly to take into account the latest emergent situations. 
(k) 
Keeping the Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation) informed of its 
deliberations and refer to that authority problems relating to security of 
the airport and its services which cannot be resolved at the local level. 
(l) 
Arrange for security awareness training for airport and other staff. 
(m) 
Ensure that security measures are duly incorporated in the airport 
expansion / alteration/ renovation programmes of the terminal buildings 
as recommended by the Commissioner of Security (CA). 
 
5. 
Schedule for the APSC meeting 
 
The Committee must meet at least once in every month without fail. 
Besides above, the special Airport Security Committee meeting  shall be 
convened: 
 
(i) 
As and when it is considered necessary to do so by Convenor/ 
Chairman; 
(ii) 
As per directions of Commissioner of Security (CA), during alert 
etc., 
(iii) 
During security audit/ inspection of the airport by BCAS officers. 
 
6.
